lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio has taken steps to make New York City a welcoming place for gay and transgender people, but some say there’s “still much left to be desired.”

headline.print_headline: De Blasio Finds Some Gay New Yorkers Are Slow to Warm Up to Him
headline.main: De Blasio Finds His Support From Gay New Yorkers Still Has Limits

snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio has taken steps to make New York City a welcoming place for gay and transgender people, but some say there’s “still much left to be desired.”
abstract: Mayor Bill de Blasio still faces dissent from gay community, despite efforts his administration has made to make city friendlier to gay and transgender people; critics of de Blasio cite his support of Police Commissioner William J Bratton, and policing policies that many say disproportionately affect gay and transgender youths, in explaining why they continue to withhold full support for mayor.
